purpose.p: This part of ISO 10303 specifies an application module for the representation of resources required to achieve a specified objective.
purpose.note: A resource requirement that is described in terms of an identifiable resource which will satisfy the requirement is represented as .
A resource requirement that is described in terms of a specification of a type of item which will satisfy the requirement is represented as .
A resource requirement that is described in terms of an identifiable item (which is not a realization of a Resource_item) which will satisfy the requirement is represented as .
purpose.example: A resource requirement that is described as a requirement for a resource that is realized by a spare part with part number "KSB 1234" should be represented using .
A resource requirement that is described as a requirement for a power supply is a specification of a type of item should be represented using .
A resource requirement that is described as a requirement for spare part with part number "KSB 1234" should be represented using .
purpose.p: Resource requirements may have the following characteristics:

ul.li: A resource requirement can be identified;
A resource requirement can be quantified;
A resource requirement or resource requirement grouping can be classified.

purpose.p: The following are not provided by this module alone but are provided by modules that use this module:

ul.li: Property, date and descriptive representation assignment;
Recording of the organizations or people in organizations who identify an item as satisfying a resource requirement;

inscope.li: the specification of an actual items or type of item as required resources;
the specification of classifications of required resources;
the specification of the required quantity of a resource;

outscope.li: the identification and detailed descriptions of required resources;
the recording of used or consumed resources.

uof.name: Required_resource
uof.description: The Required_resource UoF lists the resources required to achieve a specified objectice. The UoF provides both resource specification and resource identification capabilities.
